How much is 3 ounces of cream cheese in cups?
In: Lifestyle › Food&Drink › Cheese
Rate This Answer
3 ounces of cream cheese is 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon; most cream cheese is sold in packages where the amount is clearly marked. Answered

Facebook Tweet Email Advertisement About Cheese
Cheese is a generic term for a diverse group of milk-based food products. It consists of proteins and fat from milk, usually the milk of cows, buffalo, goats, or sheep. Hundreds of types of cheese exist and their styles, textures, and flavors depend on the origin of the milk, whether they have been pasteurized, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and aging.
More about Cheese »
About Cream
Cream is a brand of alcoholic whipped cream. Cream is 15 percent alcohol by volume, and can be a great way to spice up any number of occasions from holidays with the family, a wild night on the town. Cream should be stored at room temperature, and has a shelf life of up to a year.
More about Cream »
